about.name: About
about.description:
Hi. I'm Amie!

I began front end web development in January of 2014 when I was in search of a productive hobby. I fell in love with it and left my career as an exercise physiologist 5 months later. I spent that summer working on code before joining a digital marketing agency in August as an SEO Specialist. In December I moved to the development team. While I learned a lot and greatly enjoyed my time there, I decided I wanted to further my coding education. It was then that I was introduced to The Iron Yard.

After getting accepted into the Front End Engineering program, I was informed they did not have an instructor for the upcoming cohort, so I was offered their Ruby on Rails program. What? Ruby on Rails?

One door closes, one opens, right?

In May of this year, I began the 3-month intensive course for Ruby on Rails. I loved it, as I had no knowledge of the backend. As far as I was concerned, it was a black hole. Although I'm grateful for the education I received, I still have a love for the front end. Now I can call myself a front end developer, a full stack developer, and a rails developer.

Many thanks to my older brother, Dan, for introducing me to this world and continuing to be an amazing mentor, and to The Iron Yard, for giving me a broader prospective and endless support.

resume.name: Resume
resume.description: Please see my resume on Codepen.
